articles.description: LA MESA¬†‚Äî¬†Noodle was the first to tumble out of the cage, roused by a series of belly rubs and head scratches.She scampered around the lower-level den, bouncing around a pair of La-Z-Boy recliners, a white-and-gray flash with her long back hunched.Then two more ferrets emerged from the cage. Merlin, living up to his masked ‚Äúbandit‚Äù markings, chased Astro, who shimmied through a crinkly plastic tunnel in a frantic effort to get away. Watching him interact with the humans in his life, Astro gave every indication that he would rather cuddle with them than tussle with his cage-mate.‚ÄúThey‚Äôre so much fun and bring me so much joy,‚Äù said Pat Wright, who keeps the three ferrets in his San Diego-area home, along with a corgi and an English shepherd. ‚ÄúHow anyone can see these pets as a threat is absu‚Ä¶
articles.title: California's ferret advocate makes one last legalization push - Los Angeles Times

articles.description: by: Ryan Newton   Posted: Jun 7, 2022 / 12:33 PM CDT  Updated: Jun 7, 2022 / 12:37 PM CDT   WICHITA, Kan. (KSNW) ‚Äì The Wild Side returned to KSN News at Noon on Tuesday. Tanganyika‚Äôs Matt Fouts along with junior ambassadors showed off a legless lizard, tortoise, ferret and bearded dragon. Tanganyika‚Äôs Twilight Tour is Saturday, June 11. It is the park‚Äôs annual fundraiser that will include behind-the-scenes viewings, local appetizers, beer, and wine samples, and more.¬†  Schedule of events 3:00 p.m. ‚Äì Elite Level Safari Barn Tour4:00 p.m. ‚Äì VIP & Elite Cocktail Hour4:45 p.m. ‚Äì Live Penguin Painting for VIP & Elite Guests on back patio5:00 p.m. ‚Äì VIP Dinner sponsored by Wichita Family Vision5:00 p.m. ‚Äì General Public Access5:30 p.m. ‚Äì VIP Exclusive Live Auction5:45 p.m. ‚Äì Live Zebra Painting at East Complex6:45 p.m. ‚Äì Live Goat Painting at Tanganyika Stage (Featuring Gypsy)7:45 p.m. ‚Äì Live Otter Painting at Otter Exhibit8:15 p.m. ‚Äì Silent Auction Closes8:45 p.m. ‚Äì Park ClosesFor tickets, click here.         Greg Loos, a veteran IT executive with deep roots in the greater Sacramento area, has been named chief operating officer for Ferret.   Loos most recently served as vice president for risk, fraud and compliance with Thomson Reuters. The El Dorado Hills resident joined Thomson Reuters in March 2020 when the company purchased Pondera Solutions of Folsom, of which Loos had been president. Before Pondera, Loos had been a key executive with Oracle for 23 years.‚ÄúI‚Äôve been on board a couple of weeks‚Äù with Ferret, Loos told Industry Insider ‚Äî California. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been really exciting.‚ÄùFerret specializes in ‚Äúrelationship intelligence that can help you avoid high-risk individuals and spot promising opportunities,‚Äù using in‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tech Executive Loos Joins Ferret as Chief Operating Officer - Techwire.net

articles.description:
More zoo babies: It's ferret kit season at the Louisville Zoo                          Copy Link     {copyShortcut} to copy   Link copied!   
     Updated: 10:34 AM EDT Jun 4, 2022   
  Even more babies are booming at the Louisville Zoo. In this case, it's a whole lot more.The zoo already welcomed a baby zebra filly, three Canadian lynx kittens and four Bennett's wallabee joeys in May.Now, it is ferrets that are being added to zoo's population, black-footed ferrets to be precise.BFF's (not "best friends forever" in this case) were actually once considered extinct, but the zoo has welcomed no less than 28 baby ferrets, known as kits, already this season.The Louisville Zoo is one of six organizations contributing to help revitalize their population, and each year kits are reintroduced into s‚Ä¶
articles.title: More zoo babies: It's ferret kit season at the Louisville Zoo - WLKY Louisville

articles.description: Published¬†June 3, 2022 8:40PM    QUAKERTOWN, Pa. - A Pennsylvania pet store is asking¬†for the safe return of two ferrets it says were stolen by a woman from a glass enclosure.¬† The apparent theft happened Thursday afternoon at Pets Plus in Quakertown.¬† Surveillance footage shared by the store shows the woman making sure the coast is clear before reaching into the enclosure and grabbing the ferrets.  After she picks up the animals, the woman is seen making a beeline for the store's front entrance.¬† According to wildlife experts, young ferrets need a lot of attention and the proper food in order to thrive.¬† The store is urging anyone with information on the alleged theft to come forward.
articles.title: Watch: Woman accused of stealing 2 ferrets from Pennsylvania pet store - FOX 29 Philadelphia
